describe: Uzbekistan is a Central Asian nation known for its rich history, vibrant culture, and stunning architecture. It was a key part of the Silk Road and is home to ancient cities with beautiful mosques, mausoleums, and madrasas.

cities.name: 🏙 Tashkent
cities.geographical_location: Located in the northeastern part of Uzbekistan, Tashkent is the capital and largest city.
cities.climate: Tashkent has a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters.

cities.name: 🕌 Samarkand
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the southeastern part of Uzbekistan, Samarkand is one of the oldest inhabited cities in Central Asia.
cities.climate: Samarkand experiences a continental climate with hot summers and cold winters.

cities.name: 🏙 Bukhara
cities.geographical_location: Located in the southwestern part of Uzbekistan, Bukhara is a city-museum with over 140 architectural monuments.
cities.climate: Bukhara has a desert climate with long, hot summers and short, cool winters.
